snippet: A lower court had forced the Republican-dominated legislature to redraw its congressional maps on grounds they amounted to racial gerrymandering.
abstract: United States Supreme Court decides against staying lower court ruling calling on North Carolina's legislature, which is majority Republican, to redraw congressional maps that were deemed to be gerrymandered in racial way.
lead_paragraph: A lower court had forced the Republican-dominated legislature to redraw its congressional maps on grounds they amounted to racial gerrymandering.

headline.main: Supreme Court Won’t Intervene in North Carolina Election Fight
headline.print_headline: North Carolina Must Use Redrawn Election Maps After Supreme Court Ruling
